entry.title: Re: Conditional Suppression of Group Footer
entry.content: I think you misunderstand. The Customer (Group 1) exists and *some* detail exists, whether it be product category A or B or both (Group 2). In the case where there is *only* product category A *or* B detail records, then the Group 2 footer is superfluous and I would like to suppress it.

entry.title: SAP Sustainability Control Tower: Q2 2025 Updates & Highlights
entry.content:
In the first half of 2025, global sustainability governance has entered a new phase of scrutiny and recalibration. The EU Omnibus amendments to the CSRD have postponed timelines and reduced the scope of immediate obligations for thousands of companies, temporarily easing the pressure of compliance. However, this regulatory pause has only sharpened the spotlight on data integrity, preparedness, and strategic ESG integration. 

At the same time, investors, regulators, and civil society are intensifying their expectations. Public disclosures are no longer judged on completeness alone—they must be audit-ready, aligned with recognized frameworks like ESRS and EU Taxonomy. Companies are expected to move beyond box-ticking compliance into continuous ESG performance management, proactively steering their sustainability journey. 

SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) is designed precisely for this challenge. It enables organizations to: 

  • Record ESG factors with out-of-the-box integration to SAP systems and trusted third-party sources 
  • Analyze performance across financial, operational, and sustainability dimensions to support informed decisions 
  • Accelerate the transition through auditable, framework-aligned reporting—covering both regulatory and voluntary disclosures, powered by AI 

Building on our momentum from Q1, this quarter's updates focus on strengthening ESRS-aligned metric coverage, deeper analytical flexibility, improved auditability, and tighter alignment with financial structures. 

 

Expansion of SAP-provided metric coverage   

To support organizations on their ESRS compliance journey, SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) continues to expand its library of SAP-provided metrics aligned with the European Sustainability Reporting Standards. These include both qualitative and quantitative definitions based on EFRAG's implementation guidance. Current metric coverage is available in the SAP Help Portal and detailed in the SAP Community blog, offering transparency and reuse for accelerated implementation.  

 

Looking ahead, we plan to reach approximately 80% coverage of ESRS data points by the end of 2025, including metrics from ESRS 2, S2–S4, G1, and additional quantitative metrics from ESRS Topical Standards. This roadmap aims to enable our customers to progressively adopt SCT content for structured, auditable, and regulation-ready ESG disclosures while maintaining flexibility to extend for sector-specific or company-specific needs. 

 

Analyze ESG Data App Enhancements 

The Analyze ESG Data application now offers a significantly improved analytics experience with the introduction of the Analytics tab. Users can explore all standard custom quantitative metrics in greater depth by applying drill-down dimensions, choosing between chart or table formats, and configuring default views tailored to reporting needs. This new flexibility allows up to three charts to be displayed simultaneously, each with independent metric, period, and structure settings. 

In parallel, users can manage and switch between saved configurations of grouped metric tiles (“Overviews”), enabling different perspectives for different stakeholders or strategic priorities. Together, these enhancements empower users to personalize and streamline how ESG data is analyzed, viewed, and shared – supporting more informed decision-making and stronger alignment with sustainability goals. Find full details here: Using the Analyze ESG Data Application.

 

Custom Templates for “Generate ESG Reports with AI” App 

The Generate ESG Reports with AI app now offers greater flexibility and control through the introduction of custom templates. Users can create or edit templates to tailor the structure and content of ESG reports using available SAP-provided quantitative metrics.  

Within the Templates section, you can now select “Create” to build a new template or modify an existing one by adding sections and subsections, defining narrative text, and selecting from a predefined list of charts and tables. For each component, a content preview is available to ensure alignment with the selected reporting period. Once finalized, templates can be saved and reused, enabling consistent and structured ESG reporting across time periods.  

When generating a report, you can preview or download the result as a PDF—and for added customization, you can edit any section manually. SAP's built-in AI-assistance now supports dynamic revisions: simply select a passage and use the “Revise” option to receive suggestions to shorten or lengthen the text, helping refine your final ESG narrative with ease and speed. 

 

Fiscal Period Support 

The new Manage Fiscal Year Variants app brings flexible fiscal period support to SAP Sustainability Control Tower, allowing customers to define and activate custom fiscal year variants that align with their internal planning cycles. Whether using standard calendar months or granular date-based periods (like semi-monthly ranges), organizations can now tailor their ESG data analysis and reporting across key apps such as Analyze ESG Data, Manage GHG Data, and View Emission Dashboard. Built-in validation checks help ensure data compatibility, with options to consolidate or reimport data when switching to a new variant. This enables more accurate reporting, tighter alignment with financial periods, and greater control over how sustainability data is structured and interpreted across the organization. 

 

Change log updates 

In Q2, we've significantly improved transparency and traceability across SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT). Users can now track create, update, and delete changes to public overview configurations in the Analyze ESG Data app using the View Change Logs app. This functionality extends further, providing detailed logs for changes in business activity data, clearly showing the number of updated or imported records and distinguishing between actual and target data. 

 

New Languages Supported 

To better serve global enterprises, SAP SCT now supports Turkish and Italian languages. This update enables local teams to work in their native languages and enhances cross-regional collaboration on sustainability data collection and reporting. 

 

H2 2025 Roadmap Updates 

Looking ahead, we’re focused on simplifying and harmonizing ESG data consumption and reporting. A key milestone will be the delivery of a unified Read API for metric values – supporting both quantitative and qualitative data – to  make calculated ESG metrics easily accessible to external tools like disclosure management platforms. This API will also expose key metadata (including ESG standard references) and allow for both bulk and individual metric retrieval based on reporting scopes. We’re also working on improving flexibility in data modeling by enabling custom account groups, account-to-group mappings, and supporting activity data input through multiple channels. Additionally, we’ll continue expanding metric-level analysis, measure drilldowns, and export formats in the Analyze ESG data application. To enhance data quality and reporting alignment, we’re introducing tools for guiding data requirements based on double materiality, setting up reporting hierarchies and data sources, and improving transparency on data completeness. In parallel, we aim to deliver ESRS-aligned metric definitions that cover up to 70% of EFRAG's guidance, along with clear documentation and community updates to keep you informed as mentioned above. Stay tuned: SCT Roadmap Explorer. 

 

Additional Information 

For in-depth details on SAP Sustainability Control Tower, we recommend browsing the SAP Help Portal. For an overview of all new features and functions, check the What’s New section, which is updated with every new software release.

entry.title: SAP DM - Subsequent assignment of Routing to Order
entry.content:
Hi experts,

we are currently designing a workaround for a specific use case. To do this, we copy an order-specific routing without marking it directly as the current version. Now we can't find an option to subsequently assign this task list as the current version for an order. We can assign it to the SFC via the Production Change Service. However, as the old version remains for the order, we cannot track the progress in Manage Orders App after the new version has been created.

Does anyone know if this is somehow possible?

Thanks

entry.title: Error in updating custom field of PRPS table using BAPI_BUS2054_CHANGE_MULTI
entry.content:
Hi All,
Can anyone help me -> I'm trying to update custom fields using FM (BAPI_BUS2054_CHANGE_MULTI)

But, it's giving me and error message that is code CNIF_PI error no. 081.

My code is:-

LOOP AT gt_prps_update ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<gs_prps_update>).
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_PS_INITIALIZATION'.

READ TABLE gt_pspid ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<gs_pspid>)
WITH KEY pspnr = <gs_prps_update>-psphi BINARY SEARCH.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
DATA(gv_pspid) = <gs_pspid>-pspid.
ENDIF.
CLEAR: gt_wbs_elem, gt_wbs_detail, gt_return.
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_BUS2054_GETDATA'
EXPORTING
i_project_definition = gv_pspid
TABLES
et_wbs_element = gt_wbs_detail
et_return = gt_return.

CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ABPSN_OUTPUT'
EXPORTING
input = <gs_prps_update>-posid
IMPORTING
output = gv_posid.

DELETE gt_wbs_detail WHERE wbs_element <> gv_posid.

APPEND VALUE bapiparex(
structure = gc_structure
valuepart1 = |{ gv_posid WIDTH = 24 }{ <gs_prps_update>-zzielanln1 WIDTH = 12 }|
valuepart2 = |{ gv_posid WIDTH = 24 }{ <gs_prps_update>-zzielanln2 WIDTH = 12 }|
) TO gt_extension.

gt_wbs_elem = VALUE #(
FOR <gs_wbs_detail> IN gt_wbs_detail
( wbs_element = <gs_wbs_detail>-wbs_element ) ).

gt_wbs_upd = VALUE #(
FOR <gs_wbs_detail> IN gt_wbs_detail
( wbs_element = <gs_wbs_detail>-wbs_element ) ).
ENDLOOP.

IF gt_extension IS NOT INITIAL.
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_BUS2054_CHANGE_MULTI'
EXPORTING
i_project_definition = gv_pspid
TABLES
it_wbs_element = gt_wbs_elem
it_update_wbs_element = gt_wbs_upd
et_return = gt_return
extensionin = gt_extension
extensionout = gt_extension1.

CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_PS_PRECOMMIT'
TABLES
et_return = gt_return.

IF gt_return[ 1 ]-type = gc_succ.
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
EXPORTING
wait = '1'.


Someone please help me with this.

It'll be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: SAC Data Point Comment - Keeping Comments when Changi...
entry.content:
@onursoyer14 

I think in standard table it would not be possible. Data point comments get tagged to the intersection of all dimensions representing the value being commented on including the filters which are applied on the table. The below blog covers in detail the behavior of data point comments.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/datapoint-commenting-in-sap-analytics-cloud/ba-p/13509143

 

Nikhil

entry.content: In that case, the easiest option is to always show GF2 and suppress GF1 if the group count is 1.

entry.title: FUE consumption highly increased
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I'm writing because we noticed a significant and unexpected increase in our FUE consumption. Our balance has shifted from a surplus of 20 FUEs to a deficit of -25.

After investigation, I've identified the root cause: a number of users were reclassified as "Advanced" (at a 1:1 User:FUE ratio). I understand this is a result of the updated object consumption definition described in SAP Note 3113382.

Specifically, the authorization objects that were upgraded to "Advanced" in our roles are:

  • M_RECH_BUK / ACTVT / 01

  • M_RECH_WRK / ACTVT / 01

  • F_AVIK_BUK / ACTVT / 01

I'm already in the process of redesigning our roles to align with our license agreement.

However, my main concern is how to prevent this from happening again. Is there a roadmap or a proactive communication channel from SAP that announces these future reclassifications of authorization objects before they impact license consumption?

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: Calculation Key in Operations of work Order
entry.content:
Hello @Jaya0511 ,

Control key PM03 is used to capture the external services performed by a vendor. Internal manpower is not involved here. Cost of external services is captured in Service entry sheet. If you want to capture the internal manpower involved then add a separate operation with control key PM01.

Vaibhav Mishra

If you are using SAP ECC then go with tcode IBIP. IBIP tcode will help you to achieve excel upload.

if you are using SAP S4HANA then use Migration tool where you can upload the data using excel sheet. You need to provide necessary training to end users to use the Migration tool. 

Vaibhav Mishra

entry.title: Local Approuter not forwarding "x-csrf-token" header to backend
entry.content:
I have set up an approuter with a UI5 app and a route to our on-premise S/4 system and am developing locally on my machine.

In the browser developer tools from my UI5 app, I can see that the x-csrf-token header is being sent in the request, but in the Gateway trace (/IWFND/TRACES) I can see that the header is missing.

The result is that I get a 403 error response with the message "CSRF token validation failed".

On the other hand, when making the call via Postman, either directly to the on-premise system or even through a reverse proxy like Caddy, I can verify that the header reaches the S/4 system, and I can successfully perform an update.

The problem seems to be that the approuter is not forwarding the the x-csrf-token header to the backend.

Once deployed to BTP, however, it seems that the approuter is in fact passing the header along, because then it works.

My xs-app.json configuration looks as follows. I have tried with and without the "csrfProtection" option, setting it to both 'true' and 'false', but it makes no difference.

{
	"authenticationMethod": "route",
	"routes": [
		{
			"source": "^/sap/opu/(.*)$",
			"target": "/sap/opu/$1",
			"authenticationType": "xsuaa",
			"destination": "s4-backend",
			"csrfProtection": false
		},		
		{
			"source": "^/(.*)$",
			"target": "$1",
			"destination": "my-app"
		}
	]
}

The way I understand it, the approuter does its own handling of the x-csrf-token header, which presumably interferes with what I am trying to send to the backend.

SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime and environment

entry.title: Re: How to refer to the quantity of another BOM component...
entry.content:
Create two reference characteristics in ct04; for example COMP_4929_QTY and COMP_4930_QTY and mark them as reference characteristics. Create a Class of type 300 using CL02 and assign both characteristics to the Class. Link the class to configurable material and to the BOM components if required.
Go to cu01 to create a Procedure that sets the quantity of component 1000014930 based on 1000014929. Go to cs02, select the component 1000014930 and assign the Procedure Dependency to this item.
With the above settings, test and update here

entry.title: Re: How to set the LD_LIBRARY_PATH variable for a new path.
entry.content:
I sove in Linux/Unix system  with editing bellow:

.sapenv_«host».csh
# add path for client HANA
setenv LD_LIBRARY_PATH ${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/sap/hdbclient/
setenv PATH ${PATH}:/usr/sap/hdbclient/
setenv dbs_hdb_connect_property "DISTRIBUTION=OFF"


.sapenv_«host».sh
# add path for client HANA
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/usr/sap/HBD/hdbclient/
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/sap/HBD/hdbclient/
export dbs_hdb_connect_property="DISTRIBUTION=OFF"

DEFAUL.PFL para o ABAP e JAVA
dbs/hdb/connect_property = DISTRIBUTION=OFF

Note 1:  dbs/hdb/connect_property = 1761693 - Other connection options for SAP HANA
Note 2: You need restart instances to read again the profile and new parameters in OS
Note 3: Operating System Library Path Environment Variable
AIX LIBPATH
HP-UX SHLIB_PATH
Linux LD_LIBRARY_PATH
Solaris LD_LIBRARY_PATH
macOS DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH

I hope it helps
Sergio Vieira

entry.title: Re: CU62 - No authorization to delete change documents
entry.content:
Yes you are right. Change documents are audit relevant and they are used for compliance and traceability. Deleting them can violate audit policies. SAP recommends to archive instead of deleting.

What the other alternative you have is to archive the table instead of deleting it. Restrict delete access to a technical user. Use a custom role that allows table deletion but not change document deletion

SAP’s own documentation confirms this behavior: deletion of planned changes or change documents requires authorization checks, and they caution against granting this unless legally permitted. You can read more on  this SAP Help documentation.

My AI Experience Sharing – Setting up Joule for the S/4HANA Public Edition (Part B: Joule Installation). Please refer to Steps B.5 to B.9 with a good explanation on the subject.

Regards,

George

entry.title: SAC | Linked Variables | Filtering on chart with two BW live models not working properly
entry.content:
Dear all,

I’m currently working on a story in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) where I’ve combined two models for use in a single chart. Both models are linked via the dimension “cal/month” and a corresponding story variable.

The challenge I’m facing is that updates to the story variable are not consistently reflected in the chart that uses both models. While the variable change correctly impacts separate charts based on individual models, it fails to update the blended chart after the initial refresh. Interestingly, the first change to the variable after refreshing the story does work—but subsequent changes only affect charts that are not using linked queries.

Data Source: SAP BW Live Connection

First Refresh:

 

Second Refresh:

 

Linking settings:

 

Chart Design

I’ve seen a similar issue raised in the SAP Community, though no resolution was provided. This raises the question: is this a known limitation, or could it be a product bug?

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/linked-variables-as-story-filter-not-working-correctly/qaq-p/12179295

Best

entry.title: Re: Multiple schedule lines getting clubbed
entry.content:
As you might be knowing, SAP uses copy control routines to determine how data flows from one document to another. In your case, it is from Contract to Sales Order. If the routine does not handle multiple schedule lines, it may aggregate quantities and default to the earliest date.
What routine is set in VTAA copy control config for "Data Transfer"? If it is other than 101, change it to 101, test the same scenario. Already if 101 routine is there and still you have issue, then, you may have to create a custom routine to take care of this requirement.

entry.content:
Hello @Marcel_Wahl 

try to follow this solution. Calling BAPI in adjust_numbers gets 

"BEHAVIOR_ILLEGAL_STATEMENT."

our SAP Release..... 758 SAP Basis level 0002

does your solution not work in SAP 758?

 

thanks a lot

 

 

"Execution takes place in a transactional context: A BO implementation
is active for "XXXX". Statement "COMMIT WORK" is therefore forbidden.

The statements
- CALL FUNCTION IN UPDATE TASK
- CALL FUNCTION IN BACKGROUND TASK/UNIT
- PERFORM ON COMMIT/ROLLBACK
are not allowed outside of the "Save" method. "

entry.title: Re: SAP SF EC Time Off
entry.content:
Hello Xavier,

Let me give you detail logic for This, As you know LOA is used for long term absences and all long terms absences uses calendar days which by standard doesn't allow you to configure and assign time account type. Coming to restriction of days for only time type is through with the help of take rule which acts as a validation on days taken.

Thank You

entry.title: Re: Product Allocation : Using Mask and Selective Restric...
entry.content:
When only one plant has constraints, the system expects plan data for all plant combinations. If missing, it defaults to zero confirmation. SAP PAL uses strict key matching. If a combination (e.g., Plant 2) has no plan data, it assumes zero allocation. To avoid this, you can Maintain default buckets with high allocation values for unconstrained plants, Use masking logic in the allocation sequence to allow fallback behavior, Consider sequence layering: define a first-level constraint for Plant 1, and a second-level fallback for other plants with unrestricted allocation.

If allocation is defined for some customers, others get zero confirmation due to missing plan data. So for this, define a default allocation bucket using a wildcard customer (e.g., #) with high or unlimited quantity. Use allocation sequences like Level 1: Specific customers with constraints and Level 2: Generic customer group or # with unrestricted allocation. This way, constrained customers are checked first, and others fall back to the default.

You want to use wildcards in plan data to simplify maintenance, but the system doesn’t allow it. As you might be knowing, SAP PAL does not support # or * directly in plan data entry. Instead, Use allocation sequences to simulate masking.

Finally, the “0” column in plan data represents the default or fallback bucket. It is used when no matching characteristic combination is found and You want to define a catch-all allocation for unmatched demand. This is especially useful when using sequence groups—the system checks specific combinations first, then falls back to “0” if nothing matches.

entry.title: SAP PUBLIC CLOUD ABAP EML Defintion
entry.content:
When I use the BOI operation process and components of the production order, how should I define the type to create a table corresponding to the content in %target?
The code is as follows:

    MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_productionordertp
    ENTITY productionorderoperation
    CREATE BY \_operationcomponent
    AUTO FILL CID
    FIELDS ( material
             billofmaterialitemcategory
             requiredquantity
             baseunit )
    WITH VALUE #(
         ( %key-orderinternalid = '0000001161'
           %key-orderoperationinternalid = '00000001'
           %target = VALUE #(
           ( material = |{ '2' ALPHA = IN WIDTH = 18 }|
             %data-billofmaterialitemcategory = 'L'
             %data-requiredquantity = 22
             %data-baseunit = 'KG'
             %data-StorageLocation = '131A' )
                            )
         )
                )
    FAILED DATA(failed)
    REPORTED DATA(reported)
    MAPPED DATA(mapped).

entry.title: Re: Error Execution was halted due to an attempt to load...
entry.content:
I have a better solution . In some cases you cannot provide access to everyone.
The best solution is - Setup JDBC connectivity and move your oracle driver based connections to JDBC.
Below are the steps to be followed :
1. Copy Oracle/JDBC/lib from your C Drive to <SAP BO InstallDir>/Data Access/JDBC/Drivers . Rename it to Oracle .
2. Navigate <SAP BO InstallDir>/Data Access/JDBC/JDBC.sbo file , and define a classpath (InstallDir\dataAccess\connectionServer\jdbc\drivers\Oracle\ojdbc8.jar)
3. Navigate <SAP BO InstallDir>/Data Access/JDBC/oracle.sbo file , define the same as above.
4. Create a Classpath as new environment variable as : <InstallDir\dataAccess\connectionServer\jdbc\drivers\Oracle\ojdbc8.jar> 
5. Restart the server
6. Change the driver of the connection to JDBC.

entry.title: Re: Project purchasing with stock management
entry.content:
Hello,

If it's a stock material (a material which you procure and store in stock), inventory accounts are involved when you post the GR. Similarly, if you are using account assignment (cost center or project), the consumption accounts will be involved when you post the GR. So, it cannot be in the same time stock relevant and consumption relevant material.

The materials stored in stock can be consumed from stock using cost centers/projects as cost objects.

Additionally, you can procure materials on project stock, meaning they will be considered as stock materials, but they will be linked to a specific project/WBS element.

entry.title: Re: XD05 Blocking reason History
entry.content:
SAP doesn’t store blocking reason history in a dedicated table like KNA1 or KNVV. Instead, it uses the change document framework, which logs changes across many master data fields. How you can trace it is by considering the below tables

Why you are not able to see it in BP is because

  1. The blocking reason history isn’t exposed via a dedicated tab or pushbutton
  2. SAP doesn’t offer a native UI element for viewing historical changes to blocking flags
  3. You’d need to build a custom report or use transaction RSSCD100 to view change logs

entry.title: Re: Set Custom Story as Default Landing Page in SAP Analy...
entry.content:
@Eladtayarr 

You can configure the home screen page to some extent in terms of looks and feel but the option to set a customer story as landing page is not available. You can add the story as a featured story for easier access but to set the story itself in full view as home screen is not possible. Refer to below to see what you can customize in home screen.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/28908718d6bb431880a393d731ab908c.html?locale=en-US

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Automatic Profitability Segment Derivation in "Post G...
entry.content:
Hello @Egorov_Evgeny 

Thanks for your feedback and remark

I consistently review and verify content before posting. I base my responses on trusted sources, including the SAP KBA database, SAP Learning, SAP Notes, and official documentation.


If anything appears inaccurate, I am happy to revisit it, provide the exact reference, and ensure that the facts are correct.

However, the Post General Journal Entries app (F0718) doesn’t support automatic CO-PA derivation. Users must manually assign and derive the segment. Substitution rules (SSCUI 102639/102640) won’t trigger it automatically.

Thank you again, and kind regards.
Chuma

entry.title: Re: ERR sh: 1: fiori: not found Error while deploying int...
entry.content:
Hi Alex
sorry for the delayed response, Please find the package.json file

{
  "name": "project1",
  "version": "0.0.1",
  "description": "An SAP Fiori application.",
  "keywords": [
    "ui5",
    "openui5",
    "sapui5"
  ],
  "main": "webapp/index.html",
  "dependencies": {},
  "devDependencies": {
    "@ui5/cli": "^4.0.16",
    "@sap/ux-ui5-tooling": "1",
    "ui5-task-zipper": "^3.4.x",
    "rimraf": "^5.0.5",
    "mbt": "^1.2.29"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "fiori run --open \"test/flp.html#app-preview\"",
    "start-local": "fiori run --config ./ui5-local.yaml --open \"test/flp.html#app-preview\"",
    "build": "ui5 build --config=ui5.yaml --clean-dest --dest dist",
    "deploy": "fiori cfDeploy",
    "deploy-config": "fiori add deploy-config",
    "start-noflp": "fiori run --open \"index.html?sap-ui-xx-viewCache=false\"",
    "int-test": "fiori run --open 'test/integration/opaTests.qunit.html'",
    "start-variants-management": "fiori run --open \"preview.html#app-preview\"",
    "unit-test": "fiori run --open 'test/unit/unitTests.qunit.html'",
    "build:cf": "ui5 build preload --clean-dest --config ui5-deploy.yaml --include-task=generateCachebusterInfo",
    "build:mta": "rimraf resources mta_archives && mbt build",
    "undeploy": "cf undeploy project1 --delete-services --delete-service-keys --delete-service-brokers"
  },
  "sapuxLayer": "CUSTOMER_BASE"
}

entry.title: Are you ready for administration tasks related to the Ariba Sourcing solution?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Administering SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing Solutions learning journey.

Overview
This Learning Journey helps entry-level consultants and administrators understand the fundamental administrative duties within an SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing realm. Explore how template administrators can access and edit project workspace templates that drive project creation within the tool. See how to maintain changes and settings to help streamline workflows and control business processes. In addition to project workspace templates, see how Customer Administrators can maintain project data and settings within their test and production sites. Learn about realm architecture and identify key configurations, parameters, customizations, and deployment methodologies that align with common data administration duties.

Learning objectives

  • Understand the fundamental administrative duties within SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing.

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.
 
Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Re: Approval of Time posted on WBS Element
entry.content:
Hello @maik1860 

Thank you for your question.

For time sheet approvals in S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition, use the Team Type TSH_APPR in the Manage Teams and Responsibilities app. This team setup works with scope item J11 - Time Recording and is used by the workflow for time approval.

Could you please ensure the workflow is active in Manage Workflows for Time Recording? Check below Approving Your Employees' Time Sheet Requests  and Manage My Timesheet 

With regards

Chuma
